common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failures due to CPU incompatibility
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS crashing or failing to launch after upgrading to version 11.1.1. The issue stemmed from a new dependency requiring AVX2 support, which is absent in older CPUs (pre-2016) and some ARM-based Macs. The Pieces team addressed the problem by releasing version 11.1.2 with a fix for the AVX2 dependency. Users confirmed that updating to the latest version resolved the launch issues.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Problem:** Users experiencing issues with launching Pieces on macOS.

**Key Points:**
* The issue involved the new vector library requiring AVX2 support, unavailable on older CPUs (pre-2016).
* The user's CPU was identified as Intel Core i5-3210M, which lacks AVX2 support.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
* Pieces team acknowledged the problem and actively worked on a solution.
* A new release (11.1.2) was pushed with a fix for the AVX2 issue.

**Current status/outcome:**
* User confirmed that the fix in version 11.1.2 resolved their issue. 
* The issue has been closed. 

**Additional notes:**
* Users with CPUs lacking AVX2 support won't be able to run the latest Pieces version.

## Summary in another language:
 
##  Resumen de la conversación de GitHub
**Problema:** Los usuarios están teniendo problemas para iniciar Pieces en macOS.

**Puntos clave:**
* El problema era la nueva librería vectorial que requiere soporte AVX2, no disponible en CPUs más antiguas (anteriores a 2016).
* La CPU del usuario fue identificada como Intel Core i5-3210M, que carece de soporte AVX2.

**Soluciones propuestas/implementadas:**
* El equipo de Pieces reconoció el problema y trabajó activamente en una solución.
* Se ha publicado una nueva versión (11.1.2) que soluciona el problema de AVX2.

**Estado/resultado actual:**
* El usuario ha confirmado que la solución de la versión 11.1.2 ha resuelto su problema. 
* El problema se ha cerrado. 

**Notas adicionales:**
* Los usuarios con CPUs que carecen de soporte AVX2 no podrán ejecutar la última versión de Pieces.

Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User (PASimmons) reported an issue with PiecesOS not running on their M1 Mac.
* Support agent (Mark) suggested several solutions, including:
    * Killing the `pieces_qdrant_server` process and other Pieces tasks.
    * Providing support logs.
    * Uninstalling and reinstalling Pieces for developers and PiecesOS with the correct architecture (Apple Silicon).

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS was not compatible with the user's M1 Mac due to service constraints.
* The user was not using the correct architecture for their macOS version.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark suggested several solutions, and the user confirmed that reinstalling with the correct architecture resolved the issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved.
* The user is now able to run PiecesOS on their M1 Mac.
* The resolution is also documented in a separate issue #615.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation was polite and helpful.
* The support agent responded promptly and provided clear instructions.
* The user was able to resolve the issue quickly.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Title:** PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)

**Key Points:**

* Users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up or not starting at all.
* The issue seems to be related to a migration of data from the previous stack to the new stack.
* The issue is more prevalent for users with a lot of user data.
* The issue appears to be resolved with the release of version 11.1.1, although some users are still experiencing problems.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up.
* PiecesOS not starting at all.
* The systray icon for PiecesOS is not visible.
* PFD (Pieces For Developers) cannot make a connection to PiecesOS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The PiecesOS team has released version 11.1.1, which should resolve the issue for most users.
* The PiecesOS team is investigating the issue for users who are still experiencing problems.
* Users are advised to uninstall and reinstall PiecesOS.
* Users are advised to check their OneDrive/Documents folder for a com.pieces.os folder and either reach out to support or remove the database if it is empty.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved for most users with the release of version 11.1.1.
* The PiecesOS team is investigating the issue for users who are still experiencing problems.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue appears to be specific to Windows users.
* The issue has been ongoing for several days.
* The PiecesOS team is actively working to resolve the issue.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS High Resource Usage
common_issues.description: Users report high CPU and RAM usage, sometimes reaching 100%, especially with PiecesOS 11.1.1. This is potentially linked to the "Live Context" and Long Term Memory (LTM-1) features. Suggested workarounds include restarting PiecesOS, disabling LTM-1, and using "Optimize Memory." The PiecesOS team is actively working on optimizations and cloud processing to address these issues.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of the GitHub issue conversation about Pieces OS memory and CPU usage:

**Key points raised:**

* High memory usage by Pieces OS, exceeding 2GB and even reaching 5GB in some cases.
* Significant CPU usage, causing slowdowns and even freezes.
* Concerns about "Live Context" feature contributing to increased resource consumption.

**Problems identified:**

* Memory leaks causing high RAM usage.
* Inefficient resource management leading to CPU spikes.
* Unclear triggers for resource-intensive behavior.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Replacing heavy database technologies in PiecesOS 11.1.0.
* Working on further optimizations to improve memory and CPU usage.
* "Optimize Memory" option to unload unused ML models.

**Current status/outcome:**

* PiecesOS 11.1.0 reported to improve CPU usage for some users.
* Long-term memory and "Live Context" impact still under investigation.
* Further optimizations planned for future releases.

**Overall:**

The development team is aware of the resource usage issues and actively working on solutions. Users are encouraged to report their experiences and help with testing new releases.

related_issues.text:
[Linux Mint 22.1] Pieces OS high CPU usage
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS has high CPU usage even when idle and no LLM output is processing. Closing the desktop app or any other app with integrations like VScode makes no difference. The CPU usage sometimes drops down to 0% but immediately picks up back to 90%+. 
I dont have any local LLMs or any of the browser plugins installed. I am aware that similar issue was raised last year and was supposed to be fixed in 11.1.0, maybe it wasn't fixed entirely.


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3bedac0a-c9aa-48b9-a86a-6a3c4698d263
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @94tejas reported high CPU and RAM usage while using Pieces app.
* Support bot suggested related issues and helpful resources.
* @mark-at-pieces diagnosed the issue as likely due to Long Term Memory (LTM-1) feature.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM-1 feature causes high resource utilization on user device.

**Solutions:**

* Turning off LTM-1 feature reduces resource usage.
* Setting enrichment mode to Cloud-Only reduces local computation.
* Future feature will optimize LTM-1 and offer cloud processing option.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User confirmed disabling LTM-1 resolved the issue.
* User will revisit using LTM-1 when local compute resources improve.
* Team is actively working on LTM-1 optimization and cloud processing options.
